 @RequestMapping(value="user",
                method=GET)
 @ResponseBody
public List<APIUser> getAllUsers()
                                                                                                                                  throws DatabaseResponseException
        HTTP GET method for all users
        Returns:
        A list of user objects
        Throws:
        DatabaseResponseException - This is thrown when the connection to the database fails.
        See Also:
        APIUser

      • createUser

        @ResponseStatus(value=CREATED)
 @RequestMapping(value="user",
                method=POST)
 @ResponseBody
public APIUser createUser(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                        APIUser user)
                                                                                                                                 throws ExistingResponseException,
                                                                                                                                        DatabaseResponseException
        HTTP POST method for users
        Parameters:
        user - The user we want to create
        Returns:
        The user object that has been created
        Throws:
        ExistingResponseException - Thrown if the user can't be created because it exists already.
        DatabaseResponseException - This is thrown when the connection to the database fails.
        See Also:
        APIUser

      • getUser

        @ResponseStatus(value=OK)
 @RequestMapping(value="user/{user_id}",
                method=GET)
 @ResponseBody
public APIUser getUser(@PathVariable(value="user_id")
                                                                                                                                         int userId)
                                                                                                                                  throws NotExistingResponseException,
                                                                                                                                         DatabaseResponseException
        HTTP GET method for one user
        Parameters:
        userId - the Id of a user
        Returns:
        The user object with the corresponding Id
        Throws:
        NotExistingResponseException - This is thrown when no user can be found.
        DatabaseResponseException - This is thrown when the connection to the database fails.
        See Also:
        APIUser

      • modifyUser

        @ResponseStatus(value=OK)
 @RequestMapping(value="user/{user_id}",
                method=PUT)
 @ResponseBody
public APIUser modifyUser(@PathVariable(value="user_id")
                                                                                                                                            int userId,
                                                                                                                                            @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                            APIUser user)
                                                                                                                                     throws ExistingResponseException,
                                                                                                                                            NotExistingResponseException,
                                                                                                                                            DatabaseResponseException
        HTTP PUT method for users
        Parameters:
        userId - the Id of a user
        user - The user we want to modify
        Returns:
        The user object that has been modified
        Throws:
        ExistingResponseException - Thrown if the user can't be created because it exists already
        NotExistingResponseException - This is thrown when no user can be found.
        DatabaseResponseException - This is thrown when the connection to the database fails.
        See Also:
        APIUser

      • deleteUser

        @RequestMapping(value="user/{user_id}",
                method=DELETE)
 @ResponseStatus(value=NO_CONTENT)
public void deleteUser(@PathVariable(value="user_id")
                                                                                                                                    int userId)
                                                                                                                             throws NotExistingResponseException,
                                                                                                                                    DatabaseResponseException
        HTTP DELETE method for users
        Parameters:
        userId - the Id of a user
        Throws:
        NotExistingResponseException - This is thrown when no user can be found.
        DatabaseResponseException - This is thrown when the connection to the database fails.

      • forgotPasswordResponse

 @RequestMapping(value="user/forgot_password",

                                                                                                                                            String token,
                                                                                                                                            @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                            APICredentials credentials)
        HTTP POST method for a user that forgot his password
        Parameters:
        token - The unique token
        credentials - The new credentials of the user

                                                                                                                                              APIChangePassword credentials)

        Parameters:
        userId - the Id of a user
        credentials - The credentials in which the old and new password can be found
